These swords are imbued with no particular magic, but for those who have the strength, their great weight will smash foes mercilessly.
Skill: Spin Smash Smash foes in a large spinning motion, and continue spinning to chop them in two.

A dragon hunting weapon from the age of the gods. An early form of cross spear, it can equally be wielded with the technique of a mighty greatsword.
Its owner was the Nameless King, a deific hunter of dragons. The swordspear is imbued with lightning, of which he was the heir.
Skill: Wrath of the War God Take to the air, unshackling the might of the Sun. Lunge forward and unleash the wrath of the forgotten god upon earth and foe.
Combat Art: Falling Bolt Hold swordspear high in the air to summon fierce lightning that descends upon distant foes.

The Lords of Cinder linked the First Flame, and this Lance was wielded by their deific manifestation.
This long coiled spear draws from the First Flame to empower miracles, the memory of the Great Lords forever inscribed into the First Flame.
Throughout the ages, Lords gave themselves as kindling, the First Flame solidifying their essence into the apparition that stands as its Guardian.
Recite the tales of the gods and unleash miracles with strong attack.
The warped metal remembers the forms it took while in service of the Soul of Cinder. Surely, a skilled craftsman may meld it into its other forms...
Skill: Shield Splitter Aim carefully, and attack in a large forward lunge to pierce through enemy shields and inflict damage directly.

The Lords of Cinder linked the First Flame, and this Curved Sword was wielded by their deific manifestation.
This coiled blade draws power from the first flame to channel pyromancies, the art of fire originating from one of the great Lord Souls.
Throughout the ages, Lords gave themselves as kindling, the First Flame solidifying their essence into the apparition that stands as its Guardian.
Channel the art of fire and perform pyromancies with strong attack.
The warped metal remembers the forms it took while in service of the Soul of Cinder. Surely, a skilled craftsman may meld it into its other forms...
Skill: Agile Retreat Quickly backflip, avoiding all danger.

Greatsword wielded by knights of a frozen city.
The knights who wielded these were commanded to strike down each malformed terror that arose from chaos, and they would not hesitate even if it were their own king.
Skill: Ivory Knight's Stance Stand ready with the ivory blade and from this stance transition to normal or strong attack, wielding the sword with the finesse and agility of an Eleum Loyce knight.

Shield of Lorian, Prince Lothric's older brother.
Before Lorian embraced his brother's curse, he was a knight who single handedly slayed the demon prince, but the victory eternally scorched his shield.
The shield is imbued with the power of the gods, able to cast miracles. No dragon hunting kingdom has a ruler who cannot fell a dragon.

Talisman used by clerics of the Ringed City.
In a bygone age, these crude talismans were used to wage war against the stone-scaled dragons. Hollows would pounce upon downed dragons and mercilessly stab at them with these stakes, prying the scales away for attacks from their more capable compatriots.
A morbid irony can be found between the actions of ages past compared to the present, as the Ringed City's most staunch defender can call the hollow's old foe kin.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this talisman in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

A faithless replica of twin shields used by knights who long ago served as guardians to an undead sanctuary.
They wielded no blades, only a shield split into left and right halves, which they used to primitively crush their foes until their corpses were ground beyond recognition.
Skill: Cross Counter Assume a defensive stance, ready to counter incoming attacks with a shield bash.

A katana given by Kuro, the Divine Heir. An heirloom of the Hirata family, a cadet branch descended from Ashina.
Once thought lost, it has found its way back into the hands of the Wolf.
The name Kusabimaru beseeches, "A shinobi's role is to kill, but even a shinobi must not forget mercy." A mantra the blade itself may manifest.
Skill: Whirlwind Slash A spinning attack that can hit several enemies at once. The sharp cut combined with the force of the spin can strike multiple foes, and deal damage even when guarded.

Greatsword of the Abyss Watchers which is atypically paired with an unusual dagger.
The dagger is utilized as a wedge in the left hand while the greatsword is held in the right, a unique technique that was synonymous with the Undead Legion. Confounds foes in the manner of wolves hunting prey.
Skill: Legion Stomp Use one's weight to lunge forward with a low stance and increased poise, and follow with a strong attack for an advancing thrust.

No lore. This is actually Yamato.
Skill: Cross Counter Assume a defensive stance, ready to counter incoming attacks with a devastating slash.

Large curved sword wielded by the mightiest champion of Carthus.
That's about all the lore you'll get. Run and backstep attacks have unique light attack followups that do extra damage. This weapon is slightly bigger than carthus curved greatsword and also has relatively high luck scaling that increases bleed build-up.
Skill: Turbulent Wind Like a sandstorm, roll into foes with a large spinning motion while obscured.

A lance born from the horns of a forest-dwelling magical beast from ages past.
Imbued with magic, it is said that the butterflies were created through the twisted experiments of an insane duke. Inside the quivering horns lies potent magic, never fading.
Skill: Crystal Burst Thrust the spear upwards to release a cascade of exploding crystals.

An Axe born from the soul of the Iron Golem, guardian of Sen's Fortress who repelled countless heroes who sought Anor Londo.
Its powerful one-handed attack imitates the golem's blade of wind, but the heavy iron blade makes it quite unwieldy.
Skill: Iron Grab Reach out and grab the opponent. Can only be used against humans.

Sword allegedly wielded by servants of the Gravelord.
Numerous ancient skeletons cling to the blade, melded into a macabre exhibition of the Old Dead One's might.
Primordial tales tell of one of the first Great Lords, Nito, the First of the Dead. Waves of lethal miasma would emanate from his blade, granting all it touched death and decay. The same miasma, however thinned, exudes from this blade.
Lord Wolnir sought to control this power, yearning to find the secret of immortality within the cloud of death. His desire was ultimately fulfilled, but the price, ironically, was a fate worse than death.
Weapon Skill: Gravelord Sword Storm Thrust weapon into earth to emit a series of giant Gravelord swords from the ground.

Favored weapon from the chosen undead. Converted from a wheat-harvesting tool.
The magnificent sharp curved blade instills fear in opponents. Perhaps it is their survival instinct at work.
Skill: Spin Sweep Sweep foes in a large spinning motion, and utilize momentum to transition into an overhanded strong attack smash.

Favored weapon from the chosen undead. Converted from a wheat-harvesting tool.
The magnificent sharp curved blade instills fear in opponents. Perhaps it is their survival instinct at work.

Favored weapon from the chosen undead. Converted from a wheat-harvesting tool.
The magnificent sharp curved blade instills fear in opponents. Perhaps it is their survival instinct at work

The magnificent sharp curved blade instills fear in opponents. Perhaps it is their survival instinct at work.
Skill: Spin Sweep Sweep foes in a large spinning motion, and utilize momentum to transition into an overhanded strong attack smash.

Favored weapon from the chosen undead. Converted from a wheat-harvesting tool.
The magnificent sharp curved blade instills fear in opponents. Perhaps it is their survival instinct at work.
Skill: Spin Sweep Sweep foes in a large spinning motion, and utilize momentum to transition into an overhanded strong attack smash.

A dagger treated with plague. The blade is curved like a talon, and was once used by women and children for assassination.
The weapon draws its power from Luck, perhaps an ode to the nature of children to believe in such things.
The faint poison lining the blade is uniquely deadly, also reducing the restorative properties of healing items.
Weapon Skill: Bile Spit Release a corrosive vomit projectile.

A rare rapier with spiral grooves carved into the blade.
It is meant to inflict pain, causing both bleeding and poison rather than deal damage, providing a glimpse into the insanity of its previous wielder.
The weapon primarily draws its power from Luck, and improves the wielder's resistance to ailments.
Weapon Skill: Shield Splitter Aim carefully, and attack in a large forward lunge to pierce through enemy shields and inflict damage directly.
Combat Art: Parry Repel an attack at the right time to follow up with a critical hit. Exclusively works while two handing.

An enormous crystal sword with a crescent blade. It was forged from the soul of an old hero from ages past, if the stories are to be believed. The rickety blade has become severely weathered.
The blade appears to double as a lucky charm, bringing the wielder good fortune in obtaining more items. Perhaps as a result of this, it also improves in ferocity with the wielder's Luck.
Skill: Hero's Counter Assume the stance of the old hero and counter incoming attacks with a jumping slash.
Combat Art: God's Wrath Reverse the blade and plunge it into the ground to emit a powerful shockwave.

A blunderbuss created by the craftsman Edmond.
His firearms are specially crafted to employ the wielder’s Focus as ammunition, an evolution of his previous work on the exploding bolt.
The impact of this highly-effective weapon counters swift movements, and its wide spread is nigh-on guaranteed to hit the mark.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

A blunderbuss created by the craftsman Edmond.
His firearms are specially crafted to employ the wielder’s Focus as ammunition, an evolution of his previous work on the exploding bolt.
The impact of this highly-effective weapon counters swift movements, and its wide spread is nigh-on guaranteed to hit the mark.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A brutal weapon employed by mercenaries and madmen.
Retains the qualities of an axe, but offers a wider palette of attacks by transforming. Boasts a heavy blunt attack and crude slashes.
The cruel blade invigorates the user as it is soaked in fresh blood, allowing the wielder to fight not unlike a savage beast.
Skill: Beast Roar/Spin Slash Invoke a sense of inner ferocity and emit a terrible roar, further strengthening the healing effect. When transformed, swing the axe horizontally in a slashing motion.
Rifle Spear

A sanctified weapon typically used by pious warriors.
When untransformed, an easily handled silver sword. When transformed, a giant obtuse stone maul, characterized by blunt strikes and extreme force of impact.
Those who wielded this most symbolic weapon took a blunt approach to justice, an irony that stayed with them until their final days.
Skill: Advancing Thrust/Crushing Rain Slash upwards with a forward lunge. When transformed, raise the hammer overhead and smash downwards to raise a dust storm of falling debris.
Beast Claws
Bare Fist

An odd contraption that has the ability to harness the power of lightning.
Striking this peculiar iron morning star like a match generates majestic blue sparks.
Skill: Electric Charge Coats the weapon in crackling blue pulses that increases lightning damage. Performs a thrusting attack when used during combos.

An odd contraption that has the ability to harness the power of lightning.
Striking this peculiar iron morning star like a match generates majestic blue sparks.
This variant in particular appears to be a crude modification by simpletons, favouring brute force over Faith.
Skill: Electric Charge Coats the weapon in crackling blue pulses that increases lightning damage. Performs a thrusting attack when used during combos.

An odd contraption that has the ability to harness the power of lightning.
Striking this peculiar iron morning star like a match generates majestic blue sparks.
However, this version was acquired by sorcerers and modified to channel the wielder's Intelligence.
Skill: Electric Charge Coats the weapon in crackling blue pulses that increases lightning damage. Performs a thrusting attack when used during combos.

Weapon wielded by a raving band of evangelists.
Bathed in the blood of the insolent and forever steeped in their ire, this brutal torture device is used to rend and break the bones of the unworthy.
The wheel opens to release the fury of the vengeful spirits, manifesting their rage in a show of sanguine glory.
Skill: Wheel of Vengeance Spin the wheel up to five times to increase damage dealt, at the cost of leeched vigor. The grinding of flesh and bones appease the spirits, and allow the blood of foes to invigorate the user.

Weapon wielded by a raving band of evangelists.
Bathed in the blood of the imperious and forever steeped in their ire, this unconventional yet brutal weapon is used to grind the flesh and bone of the ignorant.
The wheel opens to release the fury of the vengeful spirits, manifesting their rage in a show of sanguine glory.
Skill: Wheel of Vengeance Spin the wheel up to five times to increase damage dealt, at the cost of leeched vigor. The violence appeases the spirits, and allows the blood of foes to invigorate the user.

Weapon wielded by a raving band of evangelists.
Bathed in the blood of the insolent and forever steeped in their ire, this brutal torture device is used to rend and break the bones of the unworthy.
The wheel opens to release the fury of the vengeful spirits, manifesting their rage in a show of sanguine glory.
Tainted by the poison gem within, the spectres emit virulent gasses instead of their crimson-red hatred.
Skill: Wheel of Vengeance Spin the wheel up to five times to increase damage dealt, at the cost of leeched vigor. The grinding of flesh and bones appease the spirits, and allow the blood of foes to invigorate the user.

This saw, effective at drawing the blood of beasts, transforms into a long cleaver that makes use of centrifugal force.
With its set of blood-letting teeth, has become a symbol of those who hunt beasts, and only grows in effectiveness the more grotesquely transformed the creature.
Skill: Beast Leap/Titchy Slash Slash the saw across the ground in a backwards motion. When transformed, move forward while slicing low to the ground before ending with a slam.

A rare weapon passed down among those who hunt men. Splits into two when activated.
The weapon's warped blades are forged with a rare mineral of the heavens. Most effective with swift attacks, such as after dodging.
Skill: Blindspot/Deadly Retreat Use against shielded foes to break through their guard by attacking from the side. When transformed, strike with a crossing slash that moves the user backwards.

Beautifully crafted blade of foreign make.
Appears as an otherwise standard weapon, but can assume a terrible might when allowed to feast on the wielder's own blood.
Curiously, when imbibed with blood, its strength depends on the wielder's luck. Perhaps this is because luck is a uniquely human quality; and it has a particular appetite for the blood of mankind.
Allowing the blood of foes to intermingle with the blood of the wielder replenishes the user's vigor.
Weapon Skill: Scarlet Slash Send a shockwave of blood through the earth.

A trick weapon fashioned by a craftsman of eccentric taste.
The Stake Driver, with its queerly complex design, violently drives thick stakes into the flesh of foes.
It allows for high-damage charged attacks, but is difficult to use and leaves its wielder wide open, but none of this bothered its peculiar designer.
Skill: Mechanical Blast/Powder Keg Trigger a blast of physical power, sending foes to the ground. When transformed, fire volatile bombs that implode over time.

Pistol made by the craftsman Edmond. His firearms are specially crafted to employ the wielder’s Focus as ammunition, an evolution of his previous work on the exploding bolt.
The pistol is a quicker draw than the blunderbuss, allowing for speedier responses to attacks.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

Pistol made by the craftsman Edmond. His firearms are specially crafted to employ the wielder’s Focus as ammunition, an evolution of his previous work on the exploding bolt.
The pistol is a quicker draw than the blunderbuss, allowing for speedier responses to attacks.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A large prototype weapon, an attempt at combining an exploding bolt and a ballista.
Use of this weapon is equivalent to toting a Greatbow on one arm, complete with its ridiculous weight, staggering kick, and lavish use of Focus, into battle.
Such a monstrosity was doomed from the start, and indeed its development was cut short.
Yet, against impossibly gigantic foes, it might be just the thing, provided you have the Strength to use it effectively of course.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

A large prototype weapon, an attempt at combining an exploding bolt and a ballista.
Use of this weapon is equivalent to toting a Greatbow on one arm, complete with its ridiculous weight, staggering kick, and lavish use of Focus, into battle.
Such a monstrosity was doomed from the start, and indeed its development was cut short.
Yet, against impossibly gigantic foes, it might be just the thing, provided you have the Strength to use it effectively of course.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A sanctified weapon first wielded by Ludwig, figurehead of a group of pious warriors. On the one side, an easily handled silver sword. When transformed, it combines with its sheath to form a greatsword.
It exhibits several departures from other traditional holy weapons, suggesting Ludwig anticipated a different approach to adversity than his peers.
Skill: Upwards Slash/Radiant Strike Slash forward to break a foe’s guard from below. When transformed, call upon the sword's guidance and smash down in a cascade of holy light.

A sanctified weapon first wielded by Ludwig, figurehead of a group of pious warriors. On the one side, an easily handled silver sword. When transformed, it combines with its sheath to form a greatsword.
It exhibits several departures from other traditional holy weapons, suggesting Ludwig anticipated a different approach to adversity than his peers.
However, this version was acquired by the kingdom of Lothric and modified to channel both the wielder's Strength and Dexterity.
Skill: Upwards Slash/Radiant Strike Slash forward to break a foe’s guard from below. When transformed, call upon the sword's guidance and smash down in a cascade of holy light.

A sanctified weapon first wielded by Ludwig, figurehead of a group of pious warriors. On the one side, an easily handled silver sword. When transformed, it combines with its sheath to form a greatsword.
It exhibits several departures from other traditional holy weapons, suggesting Ludwig anticipated a different approach to adversity than his peers.
However, this version was acquired by sorcerers and modified to channel the wielder's Intelligence.
Skill: Upwards Slash/Radiant Strike Slash forward to break a foe’s guard from below. When transformed, call upon the sword's guidance and smash down in a cascade of holy light.

A strange, yet beautiful, hybrid of sword and scythe.
Discovered in an ancient tomb beneath a Carim cathedral, some say it's magnificent design inspired the curved swords Carim knights are known for. But, such accolades may simply be the words of an unscrupulous merchant hoping to sell it to an unsuspecting customer.
Skill: Spinning Motion/Reaping Slashes Execute a deliberate horizontal attack. When transformed, perform two powerful slashes in rapid succession.
Saw Spear

A special weapon created by a Vinheim craftsman.
Draws upon the wielders Intelligence to spray a cloud of magical mist, using Focus as a medium.
It’s name resembles that of a noblewoman, and the mist it expels has been likened to tears.
"Oh, fair maiden, why is it that you weep?”
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

A special weapon created by a Vinheim craftsman.
Draws upon the wielders Intelligence to spray a cloud of magical mist, using Focus as a medium.
It’s name resembles that of a noblewoman, and the mist it expels has been likened to tears.
"Oh, fair maiden, why is it that you weep?”
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A mysterious and marvelous weapon combining a sword and a peculiar firing mechanism, created with craftsmanship far beyond the limits of any known artisan today.
It synergises practical matters of short and long ranged combat while retaining the wielder’s elegance and respectability.
Only, how respectable could its wielder have been, to bear such a lethal instrument?
Skill: Countering Thrust/Graceful Salvo Step backwards and then quickly pierce forward. When transformed, assume a quick stance, lunge forward, and execute a stunning chain attack, letting rip a hail of projectiles.

A delicate trick weapon used by noblemen and preachers.
While the cane may be mistaken as an ornate walking stick, closer inspection reveals the edges to be inordinately keen. Tricking the weapon lets the sharp edges separate into a vicious serrated whip.
This elegant weapon relies on a flamboyant use of skill, suggesting that the people employing this weapon were fascinated with formality and beauty over brutish depravity.
Skill: Poised Duet Assume a quick, unfaltering stance, lunge forward, and execute a graceful pair of thrusts.

Special and rare pistol used by a nobleman from Astora.
The nobleman paid an exorbitant sum for its creation, and no other copies of the Evelyn were ever made. A sum well spent, for the Evelyn is of extreme quality.
Lovingly named after a woman and graced with an intricate design, its attacks are boosted by that elusive, essential property unique to humans: luck.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

Special and rare pistol used by a nobleman from Astora.
The nobleman paid an exorbitant sum for its creation, and no other copies of the Evelyn were ever made. A sum well spent, for the Evelyn is of extreme quality.
Lovingly named after a woman and graced with an intricate design, its attacks are boosted by that elusive, essential property unique to humans: luck.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A pistol typically used by a group of pious warriors.
Crafted with mostly metal parts and exhibiting a complex design, the repeating pistol fires two shots at once, making it a ravenous consumer of Focus.
Its volatile and experimental design lends the weapon to scale with the wielder’s Luck.
Should be used sparingly, as the trump card in one's arsenal or else face the risk of being depleted of Focus very quickly.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

A pistol typically used by a group of pious warriors.
Crafted with mostly metal parts and exhibiting a complex design, the repeating pistol fires two shots at once, making it a ravenous consumer of Focus.
Its volatile and experimental design lends the weapon to scale with the wielder’s Luck.
Should be used sparingly, as the trump card in one's arsenal or else face the risk of being depleted of Focus very quickly.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A rifle typically used by a group of pious warriors.
It is said that this rifle was employed by Ludwig, figurehead of the group. Its long, heavy barrel makes up in range for what it lacks in reload speed.
Ludwig's Rifle exhibits some departures from Edmond’s design, suggesting that Ludwig anticipated a different approach to adversity than his peers.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

A rifle typically used by a group of pious warriors.
It is said that this rifle was employed by Ludwig, figurehead of the group. Its long, heavy barrel makes up in range for what it lacks in reload speed.
Ludwig's Rifle exhibits some departures from Edmond’s design, suggesting that Ludwig anticipated a different approach to adversity than his peers.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A brutal trick weapon used by highwaymen and mercenaries.
A second blade is found inside the curve of the main one. In its initial form, the saif can be wielded like a long curved sword, but when transformed, its blade is contracted, allowing for quick, repeated stabs.
Crude as it may be, the weapon demands ample dexterity for an adaptive style of combat, changing the flow of a conflict within seconds.
Skill: Spin Sweep / Quickening Sweep foes in a large spinning motion, and utilize momentum to transition into an overhanded strong attack smash. When transformed, call upon an ancient technique to swiftly lunge forward and swing upwards.

A brutal trick weapon used by thugs and butchers.
This thick iron cleaver slices through the toughest of hides, and when transformed the blade splits into sections, allowing one to lash it in the fashion of a heavy whip.
This crude weapon relies on brute force and is regrettably inelegant, suggesting that the nights this weapon saw use made for horrific affairs, painted in sanguine black and reds.
Skill: Sever/Chain Lash Hold the cleaver with both hands and slash repeatedly at the foe's feet. When transformed, spin the whip around the wielder and transition to a powerful thrust with the blunt of the whip.

A uniquely grotesque and brutal instrument.
The Amygdalan Arm earned its name from the madmen who wielded it, drawing etymological inspiration from the amygdala, an area of the brain associated with primitive emotions. The heretical severance from an entity considered sacred led to the creation of this venerated tool of the divine.
It can be wielded as a blunt club of sorts, but when extended the entity within stirs, yearning to spread its influence in the world of men.
Skill: Nightmare Serpent Thrust the weapon before you, drawing on the wielder's faith to let forth a shockwave of energy.

A uniquely grotesque and brutal instrument.
The Amygdalan Arm earned its name from the madmen who wielded it, drawing etymological inspiration from the amygdala, an area of the brain associated with primitive emotions. The unsavoury severance from the carcass of some horrible beast best forgotten led to the creation of this abominable instrument.
It can be wielded as a blunt club of sorts, but when extended the beast within stirs, quivering as if yet still living.
Skill: Nightmare Serpent Thrust the weapon before you, drawing on some terrible lingering power to let forth a shockwave of energy.

A mystical sword discovered long ago by Ludwig.
When blue moonlight dances around the sword, and it channels the cosmos, its great blade will hurl a shadowy lightwave.
The Holy Moonlight Sword is synonymous with Ludwig, the Holy Blade, but few have ever set eyes on this form of the great blade.
Being used for so long as an instrument with divine intentions, it comes as no surprise it sees itself as such.
Perhaps it simply has a mind of its own, for whatever guidance it has to offer, it seems to be of a very private, elusive sort.
Skill: Deflecting Slash/Moonlight Fury Assume a wide stance and perform a diagonal slash. When transformed, draw the sword back and release to unleash a burst of moonlight.

A mystical sword discovered long ago by Ludwig.
When blue moonlight dances around the sword, and it channels the cosmos, its great blade will hurl a shadowy lightwave.
The Holy Moonlight Sword is synonymous with Ludwig, the Holy Blade, but few have ever set eyes on this form of the great blade.
Light that catches upon the blade's keen edge is reflected as cold and merciless, the blade's will and judgement absolute.
Perhaps it simply has a mind of its own, for whatever guidance it has to offer, it seems to be of a very private, elusive sort.
Skill: Deflecting Slash/Moonlight Fury Assume a wide stance and perform a diagonal slash. When transformed, draw the sword back and release to unleash a burst of moonlight.

A mystical sword discovered long ago by Ludwig.
When blue moonlight dances around the sword, and it channels the cosmos, its great blade will hurl a shadowy lightwave.
The Holy Moonlight Sword is synonymous with Ludwig, the Holy Blade, but few have ever set eyes on this form of the great blade.
It bears a striking resemblance to the Moonlight Greatsword created from the soul of Seathe the Paledrake, but no apparent relation exists.
Perhaps it simply has a mind of its own, for whatever guidance it has to offer, it seems to be of a very private, elusive sort.
Skill: Deflecting Slash/Moonlight Fury Assume a wide stance and perform a diagonal slash. When transformed, draw the sword back and release to unleash a burst of moonlight.

A unique weapon wielded by a mysterious woman. This sword demands great dexterity, a testament to the finesse of its wielder.
One day, the woman abandoned her beloved Rakuyo, casting it into a dark well, when she could stomach it no longer.
Skill: Shieldsplitter/Pirouette Aim carefully, and attack in a large forward lunge to pierce through enemy shields and inflict damage directly. When transformed, perform a graceful spinning attack with the paired blades.

A peculiar hammer powered by a miniature furnace.
Striking the mechanism on the head of the hammer empowers the next attack with flame. For what reason would such a mechanism be required? Surely such a terrifying contraption was made to match the ferocity of the would-be foe.
Skill: Heat Zone Overcharge the furnace within before unleashing it upon the ground, creating an ecliptic shockwave of destruction while also venting excess material.

Cursed mace forged by a heretic.
To the common eye the Bloodletter is nothing more than a rusted morning star, but will assume its true and terrifying form after it draws upon blood from the inner reaches of one's body and soul.
Curiously, the weapon gains its power from the wielder's luck when transformed. Perhaps the human quality of luck is an appealing taste for the savage instrument.
But of course, who could reach a sane conclusion from the creation of a heretic?
Skill: Sanguine Strike Strike the weapon into the ground in a damaging display of blood, for both the opponent and wielder.
Church Pick

A vicious weapon forged with outlandish craftsmanship, first wielded by a deranged individual who sought nothing but to witness the rending of flesh.
This weapon pummels opponents in its mace form, but it's true strength lies in its attached mechanical saws. These discs, lined with serrated teeth, spin rapidly, thrashing the flesh of those before it into fine shreds.
Skill: Spin Bash/Shredding Stance Bash foes with a large spinning motion. When transformed, enter a stance that continually slashes foes. Use the normal or strong attack to slash the weapon along the ground on either side.

Choice weapon of Simon, close friend of Edmond the Craftsman.
Simon despised Edmond's firearms, and so he had this specially fashioned to his liking. The large curved blade serves as a longbow when transformed.
The illusory arrows channel the user's Focus to fire; the arrows can be shot without Focus, although the effectiveness of the arrows without it is minimal.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

Choice weapon of Simon, close friend of Edmond the Craftsman.
Simon despised Edmond's firearms, and so he had this specially fashioned to his liking. The large curved blade serves as a longbow when transformed.
The illusory arrows channel the user's Focus to fire; the arrows can be shot without Focus, although the effectiveness of the arrows without it is minimal.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A large, unwieldy device that appears to be the result of trying to fix the issue of the need to reload with conventional crossbows.
The Gatling Gun boasts exceptional rapid-firing functionality, but is considered a cumbersome weapon, due to its excessive weight and insatiable consumption of Focus and stamina.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

A large, unwieldy device that appears to be the result of trying to fix the issue of the need to reload with conventional crossbows.
The Gatling Gun boasts exceptional rapid-firing functionality, but is considered a cumbersome weapon, due to its excessive weight and insatiable consumption of Focus and stamina.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A chunk of iron fitted with left handed finger holes.
A blunt instrument ideal for those that lack the technique to properly handle more conventional weapons.
Gratia was a simple woman, with simple tastes, such as knocking the lights out of beasts with a lump of solid metal.

An oversized weapon, by human standards, created by the Giant Blacksmith of Anor Londo.
A type of cannon that fires with a curved trajectory and creates an explosion of lightning upon impact, drawing upon the wielder’s Faith.
Originally designed for use against dragons, but its bombastic design lacked the piercing precision found in the existing Silver Knight weapons.
As such, it was quietly ushered into permanent storage as a failed experiment in dragon hunting weaponry.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

An oversized weapon, by human standards, created by the Giant Blacksmith of Anor Londo.
A type of cannon that fires with a curved trajectory and creates an explosion of lightning upon impact, drawing upon the wielder’s Faith.
Originally designed for use against dragons, but its bombastic design lacked the piercing precision found in the existing Silver Knight weapons.
As such, it was quietly ushered into permanent storage as a failed experiment in dragon hunting weaponry.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

An early prototype rifle engineered by a Carim weaponsmith, creator of the sniper crossbow.
This weapon has been optimized to cause perforation wounds, but it's cumbersome firing rate makes it poor at stopping an aggressive target despite demanding Dexterity of the wielder.
Perhaps this limitation inspired Edmond to later invent pistols and blunderbusses.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

An early prototype rifle engineered by a Carim weaponsmith, creator of the sniper crossbow.
This weapon has been optimized to cause perforation wounds, but it's cumbersome firing rate makes it poor at stopping an aggressive target despite demanding Dexterity of the wielder.
Perhaps this limitation inspired Edmond to later invent pistols and blunderbusses.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

A curious mechanical invention of unclear origin.
Spits searing flames using Focus as a medium.
Despite its pyrokinetic inclination, this device would be considered heresy by the naturalistic sages of the Great Swamp.
Its design suggests a more clinical approach, perhaps used by healers to burn away rotted flesh.
Skill: Weapon Skill Equipping this in the left hand allows one to perform the Skill of the right hand weapon.

A curious mechanical invention of unclear origin.
Spits searing flames using Focus as a medium.
Despite its pyrokinetic inclination, this device would be considered heresy by the naturalistic sages of the Great Swamp.
Its design suggests a more clinical approach, perhaps used by healers to burn away rotted flesh.
Skill: Blood Bullet Technique Impale the left leg with a blood draining needle, replenishing Focus at the cost of ones Vigor.

Beastly weapon wielded by the Madman Chieftan. Those who tame the lycan are revered by the dungeon-dwelling clan, proclaiming them as their leader.
Crafted by chiseling the long bones of an undead lycan and fastening them to the weapon. The bones are still alive, and when unleashed, grant its wielder a spurt of beastly power.
As flesh and blood is spread across the battlefield, the wielder of this weapon surges with strength at the cost of resilience.
Skill: Bestial Embrace Let out a bestial roar, allowing the regeneration of health as claws tear through flesh.

An atypical weapon only described by sickly, inhuman sounds.
Once from a body of an unfortunate undead burst open, the consuming corruption manifesting itself as Abyss incarnate.
The parasite aged and growing a sickly blue suggests control from a host, although taking characteristics from its former beastly form.
Skill: Celestial Yearning Wrap yourself in abyssal tendrils, launching an explosive crescendo of arcane power.

An atypical weapon only described by sickly, inhuman sounds.
Once from a body of an unfortunate undead burst open, the consuming corruption manifesting itself as Abyss incarnate.
The parasite aged and growing a sickly blue suggests control from a host, although taking characteristics from its former beastly form.
Skill: Celestial Yearning Wrap yourself in abyssal tendrils, launching an explosive crescendo of arcane power.
